column4: hello, I have a problem with ubuntu 6.06.1 2.6.15-52-amd64-server; I am exporting a folder NFS, mounting it with NFS works fine, but working it with NFS4 gives a "ls: reading directory /home: Input/output error" error when I try ls, but writing and reading actual files on the nfs work fine. I've been googling to no avail. Any clues?
It's not really an answer, but I eventually got sufficiently fed up to switch to sshfs. NEver looked back. :P
that may be a solution, but I am afraid performance might by a problem with sshfs
In my experience, it manages "wire" speeds at least up to 210Mbit/s, eg. the full 802.11n capacity
It does increase cpu usage, but..
Well, that's the encryption. NFSv4 is also encrypted (if you're doing it right), so there's no real difference.
Or you could wait for my thesis product. Should be just a year or so. :P
what happens when a sshfs goes down, and then goes up back after a while? Is data lost? I need a behaviour like the 'hard' option in NFS
Of course, with the caveat that true consistency is impossible when the host (server) doesn't know about sshfs
But that's the same as with nfs
(Mine is, of course, handling that better. Distributed FSs usually do. ;)
Er. I mean, sshfs has never shown any such issues for me.
Nah, more like half an hour
If performance is critical, NFSv3 /is/ faster (unless you get mysterious slowdowns)
Though you might be able to set null encryption on ssh
thanks for the info, but the misterious slow downs were really annoying :-)
